page.title: 19Return of 92nd Bomber Group
page.content: On l8th May lots of Americans came to Podington for a special service at the church. They had paid for the rebuilding of the organ and had come to see it rededicated by the Bishop of St. Albans. The men had been stationed at the airfield during the war. They came to our school to have lunch. There were lots of army lorries and jeeps in our playground. On Sunday they went to the Cricket Club. Some of the Americans came to my house at the airfield because they lived there in the war. They went to see a painting of a bomber in one of our pig sheds. Lots of the Americans walked round our village. They waved to us. Some of them talked to Adam and Simon.
